section.title: Sysdig Monitoring for Kubernetes
section.p: If you are deploying Sysdig monitoring on Kubernetes, select the Kubernetes | GKE | OpenShift option. You will be presented with an access code, as shown in .

fig.title: Sysdig Monitor access code for Kubernetes

section.p: Use the sysdig_access_key field in your group_vars/vault, as described in the section . Once you deploy your environment and your Kubernetes nodes connect to the Sysdig SaaS platform, Sysdig will automatically display information regarding your setup, as shown in .
Select View Dashboard for an entry point to accessing all your monitoring data. Alternatively, you can browse to at any time to access your dashboards.

section.title: Sysdig Monitor for Docker swarm
section.p: If you are deploying Sysdig monitoring on Docker swarm, select the Non-Orchestrated: Native Linux option. You will be presented with a screen containing details for the URL to download the Sysdig agent, along with your access code embedded in the command, as shown in .

fig.title: Sysdig Monitor download location and access code for Docker

section.p: The download URL is used in the sysdig_agent field in group_vars/vars while the access code is stored in the sysdig_access_key field in your group_vars/vault, as described in the section .

Once you deploy your environment and your Docker swarm nodes connect to the Sysdig SaaS platform, Sysdig will automatically display information regarding your setup. Alternatively, you can browse to at any time to access your dashboards.
